column4: Does the freetype build available from the ubuntu repositories support BCI?? Or you need to build it yourself?
yes, it supports it.
it does not, however, use Apple's patented stuff.
does a good job anyway or apple's patented stuff does a better job?
seems fine to me, and we're not permitted to distribute Apple's patented stuff anyhow
im still not quite satisfied with how the fonts get rendered on my box...
but if i wanted i could build freetype myself with the patented stuff right?
no, you can't
we need the output from ``dpkg -D3773 -i /var/cache/apt/archives/ntp-server_1%3a4.2.0a+stable-8.1ubuntu5_i386.deb''
here's the output of that command... http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14756
pastebin the prerm from the new package.
yep, it's probably because ntpd isn't running when the package upgrade occurs
you'll need to work around it by editing /etc/init.d/ntp-server
still with me?
yeah i just opened the file
ok, scroll down to the stop target
line 24 or thereabouts depending on $COLUMNS
change "start-stop-daemon --stop --quiet --pidfile /var/run/ntpd.pid"  to  "start-stop-daemon --stop --quiet --pidfile /var/run/ntpd.pid ||true"
save it, then apt-get -f install
so i just add the || true part at the end?
yes
urm okay seems like this worked now.... but what the hell did we just do? just force it not to bitch??
essentially.
